result.execSummary:
The defendant Ned Nmi Guerra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

4/16/15: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution of $1,453 with all applicable fees and surcharges through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office no later than 3/1/16 or the 120 day jail sentence previously stayed will be imposed.

records.addlTxt: Probation Intake Order
Restitution hearing on March 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

11:17 am case called/Defendant Ned Nmi Guerra in court with attorney Joanne M. Keane.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Court reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard pleas of No Contest to Count 2-Misd. Battery and to Count 4-Obstructing an Officer.  Ct. found pleas were given FKVI, accepted pleas, and found Def guilty of both counts. Based upon those pleas, Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Court found factual basis in the Crim. Compl./Info.  The Court considered delaying sentencing on this matter until the restitution hearing and heard from State and Defense and sentenced him as follows: S/W, probation of 24 months with terms:  Restitution to be determined, follow all rules of probation, maintain absolute sobriety, no bars, beer tents, etc., etc., and pay court costs.  As condition of probation the court Imposed and Stayed 120 days in the DCJail with H/T.  Presentence credit to be determined.  Upon restitution being ordered, said payments to be made through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts, NOT probation and parole.
from Atty Keane excusing her absence
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant, Ned Nmi Guerra in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joanne M. Keane not in court. Atty Barrington heard, spoke w/Attorney Keane last week and she requested to continue this hearing, stated he did not object but would have to file a continuance, no continuance was received. Court heard. Recess 11:19am. Recalled 11:21am. Same appearances. Court heard left message for Atty Keane to call to reschedule this hearing.
Conditions same as previous bond with added condition of "Shall submit to PBT upon request by law enforcement"

Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; parties heard on motion to modify bail; Court orders bond amended to $5000 PA bond w/added condition of Shall submit to PBT upon request of law enforcement;  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Def. waives time limits, court reschedules prelim.  Clerk's office to contact SPD Office.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with KEW or BJP;  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. (12:54) Defendant Ned Nmi Guerra in court, in custody via video w/intern Austin Hyman with attorney Jessica M. Moeller.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $5,000.00 cash  with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with KEW or BJP;  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants. Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not possess any weapons.  Review hearing scheduled for December 26, 2014 at 02:45 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 30, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
